meanings.definition: To charge with the fault, offense, or crime
meanings.sent1: She accuses her brother of eating the last cookie.
meanings.sent2: The detective accuses the suspect of stealing the jewelry.
meanings.sent3: The cat accuses the dog of knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The storm accuses the trees of bending too easily.
meanings.sent5: The teacher accuses the student of forgetting to do the homework.

meanings.definition: To blame or find fault with
meanings.sent1: He accuses his friend of being late to the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The supervisor accuses the employee of making a mistake.
meanings.sent3: The sun accuses the clouds of hiding its brightness.
meanings.sent4: The wind accuses the leaves of dancing too wildly.
meanings.sent5: The coach accuses the player of not giving their best effort.
